Context: Rare condition defined by 'insistence on sameness' & social isolation.
Symptoms:
• Extreme aloneness: Profound lack of interest in others or social interaction.
• Delayed echolalia: Repetition of words/phrases heard previously, often out of context.
• Hypersensitivity: Extreme adverse reaction to loud noises or bright lights.

Context: Officially recognized as distinct from schizophrenia. Strict onset criteria.
Symptoms:
• Social responsiveness: Failure to cuddle or make eye contact.
• Language deficit: Failure to develop speech or use it for communication.
• Onset: Symptoms must appear before 30 months of age.

• Restricted interests: Intense focus on specific topics (e.g., trains, math).
• Asperger's distinction: No significant delay in language or cognitive development, unlike classic autism.

Context: Merged all diagnoses into a single spectrum with severity levels (1-3).
Symptoms:
• Sensory processing: Over or under-sensitivity to pain, temperature, or sound.
• Social-emotional reciprocity: Difficulty with back-and-forth conversation or sharing interests.

Context: Highest recorded prevalence. Debate continues on environmental drivers.
Symptoms:
• Broad Spectrum: Includes non-verbal individuals requiring 24/7 care to high-IQ professionals.
• Co-occurring conditions: High rates of GI issues, seizures, and anxiety.
